item.title: A metal chair has been thrown on the street. It has been here for months. Needs to be removed, 1st February
item.description:
A metal chair has been thrown on the street. It has been here for at least 5-6 months. It’s a hazard as somebody can fall and get sepsis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Quays Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Fly Tipped Commercial Waste, 1st February
item.description:
This is the second time within a week that a Jamaican Hot food shop from across the road fly tip construction debris in bin bags in the area pointed out. The first on January 25 and second time January 31(two different occasion photos) It has become regular practice, they think no one is watching but unfortunately for them, there are witnesses. The same was done with the shop sign when it was replaced due to fire damage. Will the council do something or fine considering I have reported other fly tipping incidents from the same source?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 192, Maple Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evergreen Close, Anerley, Greater London
